sklarpy.copulas.marginal_fitter module

class sklarpy.copulas.marginal_fitter.MarginalFitter(data: DataFrame | ndarray, name: str = None)[source]

Bases: Savable

Class used to fit multiple distributions to data easily and to calculate cdf/distribution values to use with copulas.

fit(univariate_fitter_options: dict = None, **kwargs)[source]

Fits the best univariate distributions to each variable in a given multivariate dataset

Parameters:

  • univariate_fitter_options (dict) – User provided arguments to use in our UnivariateFitter objects when fitting each marginal distribution. The relevant arguments are those found in the .fit and .get_best methods for UnivariateFitter. Default value is None, which means the default arguments for UnivariateFitter are used. The user can choose to use the same arguments for each marginal distribution by using a dictionary with the arguments as keys and the argument values as values. Alternatively, the user can provide different arguments for each marginal distribution when fitting, by providing a dictionary with the column indexes of your variables as keys and nested dictionaries of the form described above as values. Note, that if you choose to provide different arguments for different variables, all variables must be specified. If you wish to use the default arguments for a particular variable, pass an empty dictionary, {}, for it.

  • kwargs – See below

Keyword Arguments:

show_progress (bool) – Whether to show the progress of your fitting.

See also

UnivariateFitter

Returns:

self

Return type:

self

property fitted: bool

True if the MarginalFitter object has been fitted to data. False otherwise.

marginal_cdfs(x: DataFrame | ndarray = None, match_datatype: bool = True) → DataFrame | ndarray[source]

Calculates the cdf values for each univariate marginal distribution for a given set of observations x.

Parameters:

  • x (Union[pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]) – The values to evaluate the marginal cdf P(X<=x), at. Must be the same dimension as the number of variables. If None passes, the cdf values of the sample used in the original dataset are returned.

  • match_datatype (bool) – True to output the same datatype as the input. False to output a np.ndarray. Default is True.

Returns:

marginal_cdf_values – Marginal cdf values.

Return type:

Union[pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]

marginal_logpdfs(x: DataFrame | ndarray = None, match_datatype: bool = True) → DataFrame | ndarray[source]

Calculates the pdf values for each univariate marginal distribution for a given set of observations x.

Parameters:

  • x (Union[pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]) – The values to evaluate the marginal log-pdf at. Must be the same dimension as the number of variables. If None passes, the log-pdf values of the sample used in the original dataset are returned.

  • match_datatype (bool) – True to output the same datatype as the input. False to output a np.ndarray. Default is True.

Returns:

marginal_logpdf_values – Marginal log-pdf values.

Return type:

Union[pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]

marginal_pdfs(x: DataFrame | ndarray = None, match_datatype: bool = True) → DataFrame | ndarray[source]

Calculates the pdf values for each univariate marginal distribution for a given set of observations x.

Parameters:

  • x (Union[pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]) – The values to evaluate the marginal pdf values at. Must be the same dimension as the number of variables. If None passes, the pdf values of the sample used in the original dataset are returned.

  • match_datatype (bool) – True to output the same datatype as the input. False to output a np.ndarray. Default is True.

Returns:

marginal_pdf_values – Marginal pdf values.

Return type:

Union[pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]

marginal_ppfs(q: DataFrame | ndarray = None, match_datatype: bool = True) → DataFrame | ndarray[source]

Calculates the ppf values for each univariate marginal distribution for a given set of observations x.

Parameters:

  • q (Union[pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]) – The quartile values to evaluate the marginal ppf, cdf^-1(q), at. Must be the same dimension as the number of variables.

  • match_datatype (bool) – True to output the same datatype as the input. False to output a np.ndarray. Default is True.

Returns:

marginal_ppf_values – Marginal ppf values.

Return type:

Union[pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]

marginal_rvs(size: int, match_datatype: bool = True) → DataFrame | ndarray[source]

Randomly samples values from the marginal distributions.

Parameters:

  • size (int) – The number of samples to generate from each marginal distribution.

  • match_datatype (bool) – True to output the same datatype as the input. False to output a np.ndarray. Default is True.

Returns:

marginal_rvs_values – A random sample with shape (size, num_variables)

Return type:

Union[pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]

property marginals: dict

Returns a dict with univariate marginal distributions as values and indices as keys.

property num_variables: int

The number of variables present in the original dataset.

pairplot(color: str = 'royalblue', alpha: float = 1.0, figsize: tuple = (8, 8), grid: bool = True, axes_names: Iterable = None, plot_kde: bool = True, num_generate: int = 1000, show: bool = True) → None[source]

Produces a pair-plot of each fitted marginal distribution.

Parameters:

  • color (str) – The matplotlib.pyplot color to use in your plots. Default is ‘royalblue’.

  • alpha (float) – The matplotlib.pyplot alpha to use in your plots. Default is 1.0

  • figsize (tuple) – The matplotlib.pyplot figsize tuple to size the overall figure. Default figsize is (8,8)

  • grid (bool) – True to include a grid in each pair-plot. False for no grid. Default is True.

  • axes_names (Iterable) – The names of your axes / variables to use in your plots. If provided, must be an iterable with the same length as the number of variables.

  • plot_kde (bool) – True to plot the KDE of your marginal distributions in the diagonal plots Default is True.

  • num_generate (int) – The number of random variables to generate from each marginal distribution, to use as data for the pair-plots. Default is 1000.

  • show (bool) – True to display the pair-plots when the method is called. Default is True.

property summary: DataFrame

A pd.DataFrame containing a summary of the fitted marginals
